author: stack
msg: HBASE-889 The current Thrift API does not allow a new scanner to be created without supplying a column list unlike the other APIs.

author: ate
msg: JS2-972: commons-logging unsuited for cross-context webapplication invocation usage - migrating to slf4j
- adding a simple ServletContextListener for setting up relative log4j logging in the demo war
- removing invalid (pluto specific) portlet.tld and outdated c.tld and c_rt.tld and fixed up all tld uri in the JSPs
- removing jetspeed specific container servlet from web.xml (needs to be "infused" for each container)
- removed no longer used/provided (SSO demo) servlets from web.xml and jetspeed services from jetspeed-portlet.xml
- cleaning up dependencies

author: ate
msg: JS2-972: commons-logging unsuited for cross-context webapplication invocation usage - migrating to slf4j
- removing apa-webapp-logging usage and dependency
- cleaning out remaining commons-logging usages
- using Spring provided ServletContextListener for setting up relative log4j logging in the rss war
- removing invalid (pluto specific) portlet.tld which wasn't used anyway
- removing jetspeed specific container servlet from web.xml (needs to be "infused" for each container)
- dropping complete dependency and usage of xalan and xerces: using Java5 "native" provided parsers works just as well (and cuts down the war file with 30%)
- cleaning up other dependencies
